body: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JA4X1U8WfbhzBqPVz5gGEPxl289mKG5NnO6AO73*Zs5fIvoVbInnzIXtV0WnyZLihWR7*GJ1wo1tfG9hpCrXAkT68HTnXnsB/2.png)Hi everybody, i was trying to substract one geometry to another (to be precise the windows from the walls) using the boundary surfaces components and i got the following error: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/JA4X1U8WfbhzBqPVz5gGEPxl289mKG5NnO6AO73*Zs5fIvoVbInnzIXtV0WnyZLihWR7*GJ1wo1tfG9hpCrXAkT68HTnXnsB/2.png)As you can see from the previous images, in the first one everything seems to be nice, while in the second one (with a lower scale factor) i got the error... It seems that more i reduce the interior gometry and more i get untrimmed surfaces, which are wrongly counted as wall in my case. I have tryed also to do it just for one wall and one window but i got the same problem. I have to say that the geometries are built in Rhino (not through Gh) but they should be coplanar (windows and walls). Any suggestion? Thanks a lot in advance Claudia
